attributes.action: Allow HGV Drivers who are Diabetic to continue to drive LGV/HGV vehicles if they are already a qualified LGV/HGV Driver when diagnoised with Diabetis.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Currently the DVLA under the rulings set by the Minister of State for Transport withdraw HGV Licences if you are Insulin Dependant Diabetic. This is totaly unfair if a Consultants Medical can prove that the individual,s condition is completly under control and they are no more a danger on the road than any other driver. With other medical condition the DVLA will grant you back your licence after a period of weeks / months but this is not the case with Diabetis. They take away their HGV Licence for good. My husband has been an HGV Driver for 34 years and can no longer do the job he enjoys and he is good at due to having his licence withdrawn and he is now having difficulty in getting another job. He may have Diabetis but he is NOT ILL. He has a controlled condition that he lives with well. HE IS NOT ILL - He has never had a Hypo or a Hyper. I am sure there are many other HGV Divers in this situation that could and should be allowed to do the job they have been trained to do. Please sign this petition and let's raise the awareness To Gordon Brown of HGV Drivers that have had their licences withdrawn due to being Insulin dependant Diabetic, and have had their livelihoods taken away from them.
